revised_title: Aegialodon dawsoni: A New Insight into Lower Wealden Mammalian Tooth Evolution
tldr: The authors discovered a new mammalian tooth, Aegialodon dawsoni, from the Lower Wealden bone-bed at Cliff End, near Hastings. This tooth has a trituberculate structure with a well-developed talonid, which indicates the presence of a definitive protocone in the upper molars. This discovery sheds light on the evolution of mammalian teeth and their adaptation to different diets during the Mesozoic Era.
